examples.title: Environment-Based Routing
examples.description: Route requests to sandbox or production backends based on API key metadata, like Stripe.

examples.title: Basic API Gateway
examples.description: Protect your backend API with authentication, rate limiting, and request validation.

examples.title: Idempotency Keys
examples.description: Prevent duplicate API requests and ensure safe retries for payments and critical operations.

examples.title: Semantic Caching
examples.description: Reduce AI API costs by caching responses for semantically similar queries.

examples.title: OpenAI App
examples.description: Build a ChatGPT App that connects to your API using MCP.

examples.title: GraphQL MCP Server
examples.description: Make your GraphQL API available to AI assistants like Claude and ChatGPT.

examples.title: MCP Custom Tools
examples.description: Create AI tools that combine multiple API calls into a single action.

examples.title: MCP Server Prompts
examples.description: Improve AI assistant interactions by adding guided prompts to your MCP Server.

examples.title: Remote MCP Server with OAuth
examples.description: Secure your MCP Server with OAuth authentication using Auth0.

examples.title: Dev Portal with API Keys
examples.description: Let developers sign up and create their own API keys through a self-serve portal.

examples.title: Remote MCP Server
examples.description: Expose your API to AI assistants like Claude and ChatGPT with built-in security.

examples.title: API Linting
examples.description: Enforce API design standards and consistency across your team with automated linting.

examples.title: Backend for Frontend (BFF) Auth
examples.description: Secure your web app by handling authentication server-side without exposing tokens to the browser.

examples.title: Custom Rate Limiting
examples.description: Customize the error response users see when they hit your API rate limits.

examples.title: Custom Modules
examples.description: Use npm packages and third-party libraries in your Zuplo handlers and policies.

examples.title: Dynamic Rate Limits
examples.description: Set different rate limits based on user subscription tier or API key metadata.

examples.title: Log Request & Response
examples.description: Debug API issues by capturing full request and response bodies in your logs.

examples.title: Route Custom Data
examples.description: Add custom metadata to routes and use it in your policies and handlers.

examples.title: Rewrite Request Body
examples.description: Transform request bodies before forwarding to your backend API.

examples.title: Custom Base Path
examples.description: Remove or rewrite URL paths when forwarding requests to your backend.

examples.title: OpenFGA Authorization
examples.description: Implement fine-grained authorization with relationship-based access control.

examples.title: Mocking & Unit Test
examples.description: Test your Zuplo handlers and policies with mocked request and context objects.

examples.title: Schema Validation with File Refs
examples.description: Validate requests against JSON schemas stored in separate files.
